01-01.name: Solemnity of Mary, Mother of God
01-01.description: The Church celebrates the Blessed Virgin Mary's role as the Mother of God (Theotokos).
01-01.prayer: Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death.

01-02.name: St. Basil the Great & St. Gregory Nazianzen
01-02.description: Two of the four great Eastern Doctors of the Church, known for their defense of the faith against Arianism.
01-02.prayer: Lord, help us to seek the truth with the passion of Basil and Gregory.

01-17.name: St. Anthony of Egypt
01-17.description: The Father of All Monks, who lived as a hermit in the Egyptian desert for over 80 years.
01-17.prayer: St. Anthony, help us resist temptation and seek God in solitude.

01-28.name: St. Thomas Aquinas
01-28.description: Dominican friar, philosopher, and Doctor of the Church. Author of the Summa Theologica.
01-28.prayer: Grant me, O Lord my God, a mind to know you, a heart to seek you, wisdom to find you.

02-03.name: St. Blaise
02-03.description: Bishop and martyr, patron saint of throat ailments. Blessing of throats is traditional on this day.
02-03.prayer: Through the intercession of St. Blaise, may God deliver you from ailments of the throat.

02-04.name: St. John de Britto
02-04.description: Portuguese Jesuit missionary to India who was martyred for the faith in 1693.
02-04.prayer: St. John de Britto, inspire us to share our faith with courage and love.

02-05.name: St. Agatha
02-05.description: Virgin and martyr of Sicily, who died during the persecution of Decius around 251 AD.
02-05.prayer: St. Agatha, help us remain faithful to Christ in times of trial.

02-14.name: Sts. Cyril and Methodius
02-14.description: Brothers who evangelized the Slavic peoples and created the Cyrillic alphabet for translating Scripture.
02-14.prayer: Sts. Cyril and Methodius, help us bring the Word of God to all peoples.

03-17.name: St. Patrick
03-17.description: Apostle of Ireland who converted the Irish people to Christianity in the 5th century.
03-17.prayer: Christ with me, Christ before me, Christ behind me, Christ in me.

03-19.name: St. Joseph, Spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary
03-19.description: Foster father of Jesus and patron of the Universal Church, workers, and fathers.
03-19.prayer: St. Joseph, guardian of Jesus and chaste husband of Mary, pray for us.

04-23.name: St. George
04-23.description: Martyr and soldier saint, patron of England, known for the legend of slaying the dragon.
04-23.prayer: St. George, give us courage to fight against evil and defend the faith.

05-01.name: St. Joseph the Worker
05-01.description: Honors St. Joseph's role as a carpenter and the dignity of human work.
05-01.prayer: St. Joseph, teach us to sanctify our daily work for the glory of God.

06-29.name: Sts. Peter and Paul, Apostles
06-29.description: The two pillars of the Church - Peter the rock, Paul the apostle to the Gentiles.
06-29.prayer: Lord, guide your Church through the witness of Peter and Paul.

07-04.name: St. Elizabeth of Portugal
07-04.description: Queen of Portugal known for her charity and peacemaking between warring factions.
07-04.prayer: St. Elizabeth, help us be instruments of peace in our families and communities.

08-28.name: St. Augustine of Hippo
08-28.description: Bishop, Doctor of the Church, author of Confessions. Converted after a life of sin.
08-28.prayer: Our hearts are restless, Lord, until they rest in you.

10-04.name: St. Francis of Assisi
10-04.description: Founder of the Franciscan Order, known for his poverty, love of nature, and the stigmata.
10-04.prayer: Lord, make me an instrument of your peace.

11-01.name: All Saints
11-01.description: Celebration of all the saints, known and unknown, who are in heaven with God.
11-01.prayer: May the communion of saints inspire us to lives of holiness.

12-25.name: The Nativity of the Lord (Christmas)
12-25.description: The birth of Jesus Christ, the Word made flesh, in Bethlehem.
12-25.prayer: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace to people of good will.

_format_notes.source: General Roman Calendar - add more saints as needed
